name: Lusso Infantas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely weekend spent in Madrid at end September (24th). Warm, friendly, Tapas! and plenty to see. Our Hotel was pretty central ... all the sights within a 15-20 minute walking radius. 2 couples - 2 rooms - both very big and comfortable - lovely novel window shutters. About eur 170 per night per couple including a breakfast (good variety of food choices). Staff were very friendly. So, why the 'But' ....... well our rooms were on the corner of the hotel - and well on Friday & Saturday night it was pretty noisy ... and you couldn't keep the noise out! There is a gathering area about 50 metres from the hotel ... and boy did they gather (50-100) .... and talked ... and shouted ... drinking sure - clealy evident, but not creating any trouble or making you feel intimidated in real way ... but noisy - many adjoining streets have nightlife on them. I had quite a few beers each night & am not a light sleeper, but i woke 4 to 5 times each nightwith the surges of noise - the latest was 5am - i looked out the local police were carting a trouble-maker away. Hey - it didn't upset the visit! - but maybe not for any of you who are light sleepers!
reviews.title: Nice ... but noisy

reviews.text: Noise levels at front and side of hotel make it almost impossible to have a decent night’s sleep. However for a hotel in virtually the city centre perhaps this is the price you must pay for the location. Tip 1: Rooms to the back are much quieter.
reviews.title: Have to give this hotel a mixed review I’m afraid - convenient location but…

reviews.text: Rooms were compact but adequate and clean. Tip 2: Upgrade to a “superior matrimonio” worth paying a little more for that extra comfort.
reviews.title: A GOOD CHOICE

reviews.text: Service at reception was good and staff were pleasant and helpful speaking good English. Disappointingly we all suffered bad attitude from a female waitress at breakfast as she completely lacked any understanding of customer service.
reviews.title: pleasant , excellent location

reviews.text: As a plus - many of the city’s main attractions are within easy walking distance, with La Gran Via less than a minute away with metro and bus stops.
reviews.title: Located very close to buzzing Chueca District but beware of the floorboards!

reviews.text: We stayed at Lusso Infantas for 3 nights in late September. Excellent service, clean rooms and convenient to major sights. Rooms are a little small but very comfortable (quiet and with free Wifi), Carlos (at front desk) was professional, friendly and very helpful in recommending venues to us. We loved St. Gines for the hot chocolate and churros - as well as the flamenco show. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Madrid.
reviews.title: Great service, location and value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous location: a block away from subway and buses; easy walk to major attractions; next to new vibrant area of Chueca for nightlife; yet quiet enough to sleep (our room faced the back of the hotel). Stayed in a basic room, which was furnished in a contemporary style, fairly small room/bathroom, but certainly adequate and clean. This is a mid-priced hotel, and you get good value -- those looking for over-the-top luxury should be staying in the upgrade suites, or staying elsewhere. Service was great - desk staff was very polite and helpful. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent area for tourists, especially gays but not only, near bars, clubs and nice shops and walking distance from main museums and park. Comes obviously with some noise at night but good double layer windows keep succeeds in keeping most of the noise away. The room was very nice, clean and nicely designed with a tuch of old europe but modern. The common area such as the lobby and breakfastroom can use a touchup, a bit small. Staff very nice.
reviews.title: Cute and nicely decorated

reviews.text: Loved the hotel and it's central location to all the plazas and Metro. Great staff and very friendly. Downside: there is a plaza just next to the hotel that fills with young teenagers that drink, party, fight and yell all night into the early hours of the morning. Worst 3 nights of sleep I ever had. Staff tried to accomidate a room change but the hotel was full. Not the hotels issue, but I will not stay there ever again.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but very loud surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: have just returned with my partner from a five night stay half board in one of the hotels superior rooms.The building itself is very impressive and its location is excellent with easy access to all the attractions.The room was very good clean modern,bathroom was large and very clean and modern in design.The food i am afraid was not up to standard we had a vile meal dished up to us on our last night sent it back waiter was very apologetic was not his fault we did comment to each other it was because the chef was watching the footie that night! breakfast was average same old same old each day and was not replenished very regularly tea and coffee was limited and one particular morning the waitress looked as though she did not want to be there could not be bothered she was an exception as reception staff were excellent and also the two evening waiting staff.I would therefore say just do room only,apart from the food problem the hotel was lovely but eat elsewhere madrid is well worth a visit
reviews.title: excellently located hotel in centre of madrid

reviews.text: Nice hotel with a great location. We chose this hotel because it is only a 5 minute walk from Airport bus drop off at Plaza Ciabeles (also goes to AVN train station). You can also walk to many sights from here very easily. Starbucks directly across the street was nice. hotel staff was excellent as well, very accommodating to requests.
reviews.title: Good location but lots of noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights on the second floor. There was a GREAT deal of street noise until very late 3am or longer each night. We realize Madrid is a late night city but there were groups of kids just below our window. At first we thought it was just because it was a weekend, but every night was loud. I am sure the hotel would have allowed a room change but we just used ear plugs and some iPod music to make the noise tolerable.
reviews.title: Very good price-quality and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is it a good, convenient hotel...yes. Would I stay there again...not likely.
reviews.title: great location, good first class room and service

reviews.text: Over the last five years I have been several times in this hotel, it is perfectly located in Chueca, very close to Puerta del Sol and Gran Via, where you can find many shops. Chueca itself also has very nice shopping streets where you can find the typical chains and other more extravagant places. Service is very nice and attentive. They even changed our reservation to the following day, as our flight was cancelled, although the reservation done by HRS didn´t allow for that. A phone call and an e-mail were enough. Rooms are very spacious and the bathroom was also very big and clean, some of them even have a window or a small balcony (very nice). The bed is not so comfortable as in the typical chain hotels, but it is ok. The streets are a bit noisy, but you do not hear it so much... The only problem I see is that the facilities are getting older over time and there is no sign of keeping them up to date. These are little details, but over time they may be my reason to change to other hotel. It is a pity, but it seems to be the way things work in Spain. At the beginning everything is nice and shinning, and then nobody cares to maintain them as the first time.... Some examples are: the tiles in the bathroom are loose, paper on the walls falling down, scratches on the doors made by the luggage, etc. I would urge the management to repair these "small details", in other countries they are NOT considered so small...
reviews.title: Very rude staff

reviews.text: rooms are clean and of a good standard, service is decent too... the location is very convenient... clientelle and neighbourhood are vibrant and diverse... starbucks across the street... internal rooms more quiet but front rooms are brighter... booked for third year in a row
reviews.title: Very nice good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great find. A block away from the 2euro airport bus stop. A walk to Chueca fun. A hop to Puerta del Sol. Great location in nightlife central and shopping mecca. A short stroll to Prado and El Retiro Park. In room wifi, comfy bed, huge bathroom all made from great confort. The only draw back being the floorboards throughout and the noise they created in the hallway. We needed extra pillows too but the staff were only too wiling to help.
reviews.title: Chueca central!

reviews.text: This is a good choice in Madrid, especially for those on vacation and wanting to walk around and explore the heart of the city. It's close to Chueca without being in a direct party area. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are clean and very adequate. The soundproofing to the outside isn't the best, so if you are sensitive to noise advise the front desk so you can get a room on the interior. At least for what I paid, the value was very good.
reviews.title: Very good and close to the action of Chueca

reviews.text: A couple month's after staying I met someone on an airplane with an upcoming trip to Madrid for her anniversary with "no idea where to stay." I told her about Lusso Infantas and they stayed there. She emailed to say it was perfect, so I trust this has stayed a safe bet.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + breakfast was awesome, great food, great coffee
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + staff was very friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Good choice

description: Hotel Lusso Infantas is a 4 star hotel in central Madrid whose building is protected by World Heritage Community of Madrid for its architectural value.Lusso Infantas 40 rooms (32 standard and 8 superiors), which has achieved a great balance between the original structural elements and the comforts and technologies of our time.Located in the historic center of Madrid in Chueca just in the edge a few meters from Gran Via and very close to cultural, commercial and financial center delimited by Alcalá Street, Paseo de Recoletos and Paseo Catellana make our situation very suitable for both business guests and for the cultural tourist.We offer free Wi-Fi in all areas and restaurant recommended by the Michelin Guide (Ex libris), 24 hours room service, choice of pillows, amenities in the room are some of the services we have at Lusso Infantas.
